page.title: 02BADDESLEY CLINTON MANOR -1-
page.content:
The history of the manor begins long before the thirteenth century,when the {Clinton}family settled there. In 1438,it was sold to John Brome,whose grand-daughter married Sir Edward {Ferrers.}Their descendants held Baddesley until{1970.}They were a {Roman Catholic}family,and in the sixteenth century when religion was very turbulent,the manor house was used as a{hiding-place}for Jesuit priests who were being persecuted.
{The house}is enclosed by trees and lies in a hollow of the park,and therefore cannot be seen from the road. It is not a large manor,but very picturesque with grey stone walls,tile roofs and tall red chimneys. It is suurrounded by a moat.
